item.title: Active Listening
item.description: Tags: Relevant Notes mh Notes Active listening involves consciously paying attention to who you’re listening to. Skills Reflection Labelling emotions Asking questions Empathy Lived experienced Identify strengths It involves mindfulness. Self-awareness is important. Be aware of Listening filters Personal thoughts Show you’re listening through body language/ PEA approach Highlights Active listening is a great technique to help people feel better when they are going through hard times, dealing with loss, struggling with health issues, or just need to vent.

item.title: Check your privilege
item.description: Tags: Relevant Notes life-advice relating Notes Quotes â€œSome people are sharp and others dull; some are raised in a better environment, others in worse, the latter, having inferior habits and nurture, will require more by way of proof and careful instruction to master these teachings and to be formed by themâ€”in the same way that bodies in a bad state must be given a great deal of care when perfect health is sought.

item.title: Circular Economy
item.description: Tags: in-progress Relevant Notes Notes Highlights How Circular is the Circular Economy? - Local Futures 1 In the circular economy, resources would be continually re-used, meaning that there would be no more mining activity or waste production. The stress is on recycling, made possible by designing products so that they can easily be taken apart. Several scientific studies (see references) describe the concept as an â€œidealised visionâ€, a â€œmix of various ideas from different domainsâ€, or a â€œvague idea based on pseudo-scientific conceptsâ€.

item.title: Design is political x Decolonizing design
item.description: Notes Western ideologies have shaped our concepts of “preferable design” Anything outside these Western preferences are seen as different We should remove the distinction of art and craft1 The concept of a difference between art and craft reflect classist distinctions from the West Highlights What Does It Mean to Decolonize Design? 2 â€œColonizationâ€ is rooted in indigenous peoplesâ€™ experiences of oppressionâ€”specifically, the seizure of native resources, as well as the embedding of Western ideology into society The work designers make is inspired by taste, and taste is often derived from what weâ€™re exposed to during our upbringing.

item.title: Design Teams
item.description: Tags: writing Relevant Notes leadership in design work-culture Notes How to build a design team Work cultures & environments are differentâ€“we hire people that would complement the team. The filtering process is important as every member contributes to the overall flow of the team Baseline process: How well will this person work with the team culture? What are our values?

item.title: Feedback
item.description: Tags: might-publish , writing Related to: No to micromanaging life-advice I really value the importance of giving feedback. Our words are too powerful to impart things callously. I’ve seen people give feedback differently, and I think there’s no super perfect formula into giving it because people are so unpredictable and subjective. I adjust my approach, but what I always seek to maintain is to relay feedback in a constructive manner that helps a person move forward concretely.

item.title: How to Be Stoic
item.description: Still finding where I got these! Tags: philo Relevant Notes What to answer to mamamatay rin tayong lahat Notes Highlights Dichotomy of Control â€œThe chief task in life is simply this: to identify and separate matters so that I can say clearly to myself which are externals not under my control, and which have to do with the choices I actually control. Where then do I look for good and evil?

item.title: How to Change Your Life
item.description: Tags: extra-push Relevant Notes Notes Highlights Three Steps To Transform Your Life1 From a YT Comment Step 1. Laser focus on what you want and only what you want. Don’t talk yourself or allow yourself to be talked out of your desire. Write it down. Don’t let yourself get distracted. Step 2. Question what you consciously and unconsciously believe about your desire. Limiting beliefs prevent us from getting what we desire.

item.title: Interviews for Leaderships in Organizations
item.description: Tags: writing Relevant Notes Common Questions Tell me about yourself. Why do you want this position? Are you aware of XYZ and its projects? How would you encourage members to join projects/ events? Do you have any projects in mind for the organization? What are your past relevant experience? What will you bring? Tell me about a time you demonstrated leadership skills. What are you most passionate about? What is your personal mission statement?

item.title: Navigating the Garden
item.description: Hello! ğŸ‘‹ Thank you so much for being here! In this page, I map out how this garden is structured for ease of navigation. There are a lot of links & backlinks, so it can get confusing! ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’« Structure ğŸ› Digital gardens are composed of notes that are interlinked for the purpose of linking thinking. As such, there are notes inside notes. I structured my garden in this manner from when you navigate from the homepage.

item.title: Never be afraid to ask for help
item.description: Tags: Relevant Notes life-advice vulnerability Notes There’s nothing wrong with asking for help The idea of how some people appear successful/ “perfect” may create a barrier for them to becoming vulnerable. This prevents them from asking for help and lets them suffer along in private pain. You cannot help others till you learn how to ask yourself. Highlights 7 Cups for the Searching Soul | The 7 Cups Community “If you are ashamed of admitting that you have problems, then you cannot ask for help.

item.title: On Digital Gardens
item.description: This digital garden is one of my personal projects this year! I’m still learning if there’s a proper way of setting it up. I realized how unconducive for permanence my past notes were. I literally have too much bookmark managers + mind dumps (thanks Apple Notes, Telegram, Messenger, Mem.ai for keeping up with me). This digital garden serves as my personal knowledge management system. I’m a really forgetful person who tends to highlight stuff and tbh rarely comes back to them!

item.title: On Relating to Others
item.description: Notes Relating others requires conscious effort and conscious choices. You do not get better at it immediately. Highlights Relating to others is also a process we learn consciously that eventually becomes unconscious.1 7 Cups for the Searching Soul ↩︎

We each have a unique reason for being, which can be adjusted or transformed many times over the years.” Ikigai by Hector Garcia I’m still thinking about if I agree with this. I think that you can create and define your purpose in life, not solely discover it.

item.title: Psychological Safety
item.description: Tags: Relevant Notes leadership Notes While there is an idea that creating time for check-ins/ socio-emotional involvement within the team, it’s always an investment. Good working environments/ good working cultures foster creativity and good dynamics within the team. Highlights “The behaviors that create psychological safety â€” conversational turn-taking and empathy â€” are part of the same unwritten rules we often turn to, as individuals, when we need to establish a bond.

item.title: Quotes on Stoicism
item.description: Source: Tags: #stoicism Relevant Notes Thoughts: Quotes â€œWe are often more frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.â€ â€” Seneca â€œItâ€™s silly to try to escape other peopleâ€™s faults. They are inescapable. Just try to escape your own.â€ â€”Marcus Aurelius â€œOur life is what our thoughts make it.â€ â€” Marcus Aurelius â€œIf anyone tells you that a certain person speaks illâ€” of you, do not make excuses about what is said of you but answer, â€˜He was ignorant of my other faults, else he would not have mentioned these alone.

item.title: Should you send a thank you note?
item.description: Tags: pondering Relevant Notes career-advice Notes TLDR; Yes. Highlights Thanks or no thanks? Sending a note1 They suggest: Sending a note. Making it handwritten or digital. Making it personal. Showing that youâ€™re interested in the job. Showing that you paid attention to the conversation. Eno Eka I always send a thank you note/ email and I advise my clients to do so because: It is the polite thing to do.

item.title: Vulnerability
item.description: Tags: Relevant Notes Notes Practice vulnerability in your approach. Stay authentic. Highlights Concepts We become closer with people when weâ€™re vulnerable.12 Itâ€™s easy for us to think that weâ€™re too selfish, but in fact, most of us arenâ€™t anywhere near selfish enough. Weâ€™re not used to putting our own needs, wants, desires centre stage because weâ€™re â€˜goodâ€™ people.12 Cases Instead of asking â€œwhat do you do?

item.title: What to answer to 'mamamatay rin tayong lahat'
item.description: Tags: writing Relevant Notes This may seem.. morbid. While I do admit that I sometimes say “Mamamatay din tayong lahat” in an escapist manner (albeit true), I do acknowledge that it is true, comforting, and a good way to move forward when it comes to handling problems. However, this acceptance into the finite nature of life also makes one prone to not living ceasing each day.

item.title: Your career is not a life sentence
item.description: Tags: Relevant Notes stoicism Notes Highlights “We must not get so wrapped up in our work that we think weâ€™re immune from the reality of aging and life. Who wants to be the person who can never let go? Is there so little meaning in your life that your only pursuit is work until youâ€™re eventually carted off in a coffin? Take pride in your work.
